alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Crawford; Greene; Marshall; Story; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 19 at 2:01PM CDT until August 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 105 expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 110 possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Iowa. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Monday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Today will be the beginning of an extended period of heat and humidity. The long duration of the heat can be particularly hard on the very young, the elderly and those with medical conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
